intro: Mallotus philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine mahogany or red mangrove, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in brackish water environments. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in catkins. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by water. This species plays an important ecological role in coastal and estuarine ecosystems.
